intro: Helianthus maximiliani var. paniculata, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a striking annual plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It features large, bright orange to red composite flowers that resemble the sunflower, with showy ray florets surrounding a dense, spiky central disk.
